article_title: Elderly, ambulatory surgery patients at greater risk for readmissions
article_text:

article_metadata.description: Patients 65 and older who have ambulatory surgery are more likely to be readmitted to the hospital within 30 days than younger patients, regardless of their health before surgery, reports a new, large national Northwestern Medicine study published in the Journal of the American Geriatrics Society.
